intro: Tetralepis australis, commonly known as the Southern grass tree, is a unique plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its tall, grass-like foliage and a single, woody flowering stem. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. It is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Due to its ecological significance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
